A suicide bomber rams a car into an Iraqi police station and kills at least 18.
Red Cross officials recover at least 60 bodies in the aftermath of the Ivory Coast conflict.
Syria begins a military withdrawal from the city of Daraa after deadly clashes.
US Secretary of State Hillary Clinton meets with the 22 - nation Libya contact group in a bid to help Libya's opposition.
Workers enter the number one reactor building at the Fukushima plant for the first time since the disaster.
Claude Choules the last known surviving combat veteran of World War I dies at 110.
